description: Dive into "Picture-Perfect Marbella: Capture the Magic" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Picture-Perfect Marbella: Capture the Magic

places.generalDescription: Puerto Ban√∫s is a charming town on the Malaga coast, offering a wonderful climate, beautiful beaches, and excellent sports facilities. The iconic marina attracts some of the world's largest and most luxurious yachts each year. Surrounded by exclusive developments, it features a select leisure area with high-end restaurants, shops offering major international fashion brands, and luxury items.

sources.snippet: (New Andalusia) was the brainchild of Jos√© Ban√∫s, a property developer who had a vision to create a new and totally exclusive European resort, designed by Noldi Schreck, one of the key architects who developed Beverly Hills in Los Angeles. The core of the area, Puerto Ban√∫s, opened in 1970 with a ceremony was attended by billionaire Aga Khan IV, director Roman Polanski, singer Julio Iglesias, Playboy founder Hugh Hefner, and Prince Rainier and Princess Grace of Monaco. This star-studded launch set the tone for the area‚Äôs future.
sources.shortName: The 6 Best Places to Live in Marbella

sources.snippet: Puerto Banus is a destination known for its exclusivity and the visits of celebrities; there are even those who have decided to make Nueva Andalucia their second home. Don't be intimidated by photos and videos of exotic cars and luxury yachts; it is an affordable destination for any pocket if you know how to control your wallet.
sources.shortName: Puerto Banus and Nueva Andalucia, things to do and places to visit

sources.snippet: We are sure that after the walk, you will enjoy even more of Puerto Banus, one of the symbols of the city and its luxuries. We recommend that you put on comfortable footwear. Get ready to walk a total of 7 kilometres.
sources.shortName: 50 things to see and do in Marbella, Costa del Sol

places.name: Puerto Ban√∫s

reviews.text:
Wow what a amazing place, nice cars, Nice boats, Nice restaurants and Bars,
This  is the place to see and visit if you are heading to Spain.
Food, location, Atmosphere everything was perfect for a day or 2!! Lol

Take a look at how the other half live! Plenty of swanky boutiques and luxury yachts make this the Costa del Sol's answer to Monaco. We had a pleasant stroll soaking it all in before following the coast in a pleasant walk to Marbella.
Just speechless. Everything a vacay place can offer. From beaches to clubs. From shopping to restaurants.. an amazing place to have a leisurely holiday‚Ä¶

places.generalDescription: Parque de la Alameda is a charming city-center park with a rich history and diverse attractions. It features a beautiful fountain dating back to 1792, as well as botanic gardens, stone benches, and winding paths for leisurely strolls. The park also houses rare plants and open-air statues by Salvador Dali, adding an artistic touch to the natural surroundings. Families can enjoy the nostalgic merry-go-round while taking in the tranquil greenery and exquisite Spanish tiles that adorn the benches.

sources.snippet: La Alameda Park isn‚Äôt the biggest park in Marbella, but it‚Äôs a hundred per cent worth seeing. When I walk through La Alameda Park, I feel immersed in an oasis. If it‚Äôs a hot day in Marbella, this is one of my favourite places to chill and escape the sun.
sources.shortName: 15 Stunning Marbella Instagram Spots (Map Included!)
17 best Instagram photo spots in Marbella Old Town, Spain

places.name: Parque de la Alameda

reviews.text: A lovely (old world) park area, full of vegetation (trees etc), with plenty of seating to enjoy the peace and tranquility, the two ponds like fountains add to the beauty of the area.

The park is a well-maintained green space with walking paths, fountains, and a wide variety of plants. Majestic trees provide shade throughout the area, creating a pleasant environment for a walk or a break. Benches decorated with tiles are placed in different spots, offering comfortable seating. It is a calm and peaceful place to relax and enjoy the surrounding....

Quite small area. You can rest on colorful benches, paintings on each bench looks like mosaics. A lot of green trees. There is a fountain, but doesn't seem to be working. The history of this place dates back to the XVIII century.

places.address: Av. Ram√≥n y Cajal, s/n, 29602 Marbella, M√°laga, Spain

sources.snippet: The golden hour in Marbella is special, I don‚Äôt know how to explain it, but there‚Äôs something unique about sunsets in the city. One of my favourite places to take photos in Marbella at sunset is Embarcadero, the pier next to the Marbella Club Hotel. However, any shots taken on the beach are good, especially with the pretty pastel sky colours.
sources.shortName: 15 Stunning Marbella Instagram Spots (Map Included!)

places.name: Embarcadero

reviews.text: Amazing View & Very Relaxing
A lovely wooden jetty jutting out from Playa de nagueles, adding to the beauty of the area. One of many things to see whilst enjoying the walk from Puerto de Banus to Marbella old town.
Spacious beach, but not very clear water. There are beach bars every 500~600m. There is walking area next to the beach. Ideal for jogging.

places.address: Urb. Marbella Country Club, 172, 29602 Marbella, M√°laga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Rosas Caf√© Marbella is a trendy and stylish bistro cafe located near the harbor of Puerto Banus. The decor is striking, featuring a wall adorned with 30,000 silk flowers in shades of pink, creating a cozy and inviting atmosphere. This flagship cafe offers a mix of healthy organic options and indulgent pastries and cakes. It's the perfect spot for enjoying a fashionable cup of coffee, delightful breakfast, or lunch with friends.

sources.snippet: ROSAS Group announced the opening of their flagship bistro caf√© in Marbella in the summer of 2018 in the busy area of Playa del Duque in Puerto Ban√∫s. An elegant, on-trend Caf√© Restaurant that whilst having a focus on Healthy Organic Eating also caters for a little of what you fancy too with some of the most divine patisserie and cakes in Marbella!. Just a few minutes walk from the...
sources.shortName: Most Instagrammable Brunch Spots In Marbella

sources.snippet: Located near Puerto Banus, you might want to add this cafe to your list. It‚Äôs impossible to miss with its big sign that says Rosas and light pink outdoor seating. However, I also love the interior, which has a wall full of roses, a swing, and just the overall decor, which is so stylish!
sources.shortName: 15 Stunning Marbella Instagram Spots (Map Included!)

places.name: Rosas Caf√© Marbella

reviews.text: My family and I had a fantastic experience at Rosas Caf√©! The food was absolutely delicious, and the coffee was exquisite-beautifully crafted with unique flavours. It's a very family-friendly spot with a diverse menu that has something for everyone. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, making it a perfect place to relax and enjoy a meal. The staff were incredibly welcoming, and a special shout-out to the manager, Raphael, who went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect. Highly recommend this gem if you're looking for great food, amazing coffee, and a beautiful ambiance!

Visited for Brunch on a Saturday, the wait in the line was about 15-20 mins. Was sat indoors and the seating arrangements were nice. It was busy but the inside was roomy so we didn't feel cramped. For drinks, we ordered the pineapple blush and iced latte. Wouldn't recommend the pineapple blush as it was just sour with no sweetness. The iced latte was creamy with a good milk to coffee ratio. For food, we ordered Rosa's Eggs and an Eggs Royal. Rosa's Eggs portion was smaller than expected and the toast on the bottom was extremely hard to cut into and bite. It was really good with the hollandaise sauce from the Eggs Royal. Eggs Royal was great as well but the salmon was a bit too fishy. Overall, the service was decent. Food took about 15 mins to come to the table and staff was attentive.

We had an amazing experience at Rosas! The food was absolutely delicious ‚Äì every dish was fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The atmosphere was bright and lively, perfect for a pleasant daytime meal. Special thanks to Mohammed for his outstanding service ‚Äì he was friendly, attentive, and made sure we had everything we needed. Highly recommend üôè

places.address: Gaviotas IV, Av. Playas del Duque, Local 3, 29660 Marbella, M√°laga, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Museo del Grabado Espa√±ol Contempor√°neo, or the Museum of Contemporary Spanish Printmaking, is a cultural gem nestled in the historic old town of Marbella, Spain. This museum is dedicated to preserving and promoting contemporary Spanish printmaking, showcasing a diverse range of engravings and graphic works created through techniques like etching, lithography, and screen printing.

sources.shortName: 13 Top-Rated Attractions & Things to Do in Marbella

places.name: Museo del Grabado Espa√±ol Contempor√°neo

reviews.text:
Beautiful building, historically an old hospital facility, now being nicely repurposed as a small city contemporary art museum. Think Picasso, Warhol, etc.

Staff was super friendly, and enthusiastic about it too, which is fun. Did I mention that it is currently FREE. I love cool and free things.

Title: Small and Modest Collection

Review:
I recently visited the Museo del Grabado in Marbella. It's a quiet, modest museum with a small collection of contemporary graphic art. Worth a short stop if you're in the Old Town, but not a must-see.

Fabulous museum in the centre of Marbella so many expositions great hard work it's a must to visit.

Museo del Grabado is located in the Oldtown everybody should give you directions to where it actually is situated.

So beautifully laid out with some fabulous artwork from Picasso from Joan Mir√≥ are among some of the fabulous artists featured here in the museum.

The staff are very friendly and very informative they give you all information and a mini tour before you start taking access to the main galleries.

Well worth a visit if you're in Marbella please don't miss it you'll be very surprised.

places.address: C. Hospital Baz√°n, s/n, 29601 Marbella, M√°laga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Marbella Grand Mosque, also known as King Abdul Aziz Mosque, is a stunning Islamic place of worship located in the Province of Malaga, Andalusia, Spain. It's a captivating blend of Andalusian and Islamic architecture that provides an inspiring experience for all visitors. The mosque offers a haven of tranquility amidst the bustling city of Marbella, with its expansive courtyard exuding serenity.

sources.snippet: In Marbella's charming Old Town (Casco Antiguo), the Plaza de los Naranjos is the place where locals and tourists come to socialize and relax. A number of attractions line the square, and several restaurants with outdoor patio seating are set beneath leafy trees.
sources.shortName: 13 Top-Rated Attractions & Things to Do in Marbella

places.name: Marbella Grand Mosque

reviews.text:
Marbella Grand Mosque is a beautifully constructed and serene place of worship, offering a cool and refreshing refuge from the intense summer heat. The mosque's architecture is stunning, with intricate details that create a peaceful and inviting atmosphere. Inside, it is impeccably clean and well-maintained, providing a calm environment for prayer and reflection.

Parking is very easy, with plenty of spaces available, ensuring a stress-free visit. The local community is warm and welcoming, adding to the mosque's inviting charm. Marbella Grand Mosque is not only a place of spiritual solace but also a lovely spot to experience the harmony and hospitality of the local community.

An absolutely beautiful and peaceful place of worship. The mosque in Marbella is not only architecturally stunning with its elegant design and serene surroundings, but it also offers a deeply welcoming and spiritual atmosphere. Whether you're visiting for daily prayers or just passing through, the tranquility here is palpable.

The facilities are well-maintained, clean, and thoughtfully designed for both locals and visitors. There's ample space for prayer, and the wudu (ablution) areas are spotless. The community members and staff were warm, respectful, and accommodating, making the experience even more uplifting.

Located in a calm part of town, it's the perfect spot to reconnect spiritually amidst the busyness of Marbella. Truly a must-visit for any Muslim traveling through the Costa del Sol.

One of a kind.

I was lucky enough to read my Eid-ul-Adha prayers in the spiritual serenity of this mosque.

Located on a hill with it's beautiful views, away from the bustling noise of traffic and the hustle bustle of daily life, this picturesque mosque gave me a sense of tranquil and calm.

The wonderfully soothing ambience invoked a feeling of comfort which touched me deeply.

The nearby location of my hotel, being able to hear the adhaans only enhanced the experience.

A mesmerising spot, ideal to worship, reflect, and take in the wonders of it's rich history. 5/5

places.address: s 29602, Urb. Lomas Marbella-S, 18, 29602 Marbella, M√°laga, Spain

places.generalDescription: Puerto Ban√∫s, located in Marbella, is a renowned hotspot that has become synonymous with luxury and opulence since its establishment in the 1970s. The marina is filled with extravagant yachts, while the nearby beaches are bustling with upscale bars and restaurants. High-end fashion boutiques line Calle Ribera, and a striking bronze rhinoceros sculpture by Salvador Dali adorns the Cristamar roundabout.

sources.snippet: Replete with restaurants, nightclubs, and swanky designer boutiques, Puerto Ban√∫s is Spain‚Äôs most luxurious marina. Every year, 5 million visitors, mostly headliners and wealthy yacht vacationers, invade this well-heeled enclave to enjoy the glamorous lifestyle, soak up the sun on Blue Flag beaches, and party in style till dawn. Designed in the ‚Äò70s to resemble an old Spanish fishing village, this purpose-built resort about 7 km from Marbella is now one of the most fashionable addresses on the Med.
sources.shortName: The 10 Most Fashionable Adresses to Be Seen At in Marbella

sources.snippet: The world famous jet set marina is a haven for the Insta crowd, the supercars, superyachts and occasional supermodel making it fertile photo ground. Being lucky enough to live here, we occasionally get a little blas√© about Banus, but if you take a stroll to the tower at the habour entrance and watch the yachts cruise in, and then turn around to see the marina with La Concha in the background and sun beaming down, you realize that Marbella really is somewhere special.
sources.siteName: BRIGHT. | Brilliant ideas for better living
sources.shortName: The Most ‚ÄúInstagrammable‚Äù places in Marbella

sources.snippet: If you like to walk, this is one of the things to do in Marbella. We are sure that after the walk, you will enjoy even more of Puerto Banus, one of the symbols of the city and its luxuries. We recommend that you put on comfortable footwear.
sources.shortName: 50 things to see and do in Marbella, Costa del Sol

sources.snippet: Puerto Ban√∫s in Marbella is indeed a top photo spot for photoshoots due to its glamorous and picturesque setting. Here are five reasons why Puerto Ban√∫s is a sought-after location‚Ä¶
sources.shortName: Best Photo and Photography Spots in Marbella
13 Top-Rated Attractions & Things to Do in Marbella

places.name: Puerto Ban√∫s

places.generalDescription: Av. del Mar is a picturesque walkway located near Alameda Park, leading to the beach and adorned with ten Salvador Dali sculptures. While there are rumors that these sculptures are replicas, they still add charm to the area and are definitely worth admiring. Additionally, just a block away from the beach is Constitution Park, offering a larger green space for visitors to enjoy.

sources.snippet: Avenida del Mar is home to many sculptures made by the Spanish artist Salvador Dali. Walk down towards the beach promenade as you take out your phone or camera and take photos of these unique statues.
sources.shortName: 15 Stunning Marbella Instagram Spots (Map Included!)

sources.snippet: Enjoy the best of art is another of the many things you can do in Marbella. To this end, we invite you to take a stroll by the Avenida del Mar. You will find an open-air museum.
sources.shortName: 50 things to see and do in Marbella, Costa del Sol
13 Top-Rated Attractions & Things to Do in Marbella

places.name: Av. del Mar

places.generalDescription: Parque de la Constituci√≥n is a serene garden park located near the center of Marbella, offering a peaceful escape from the bustling city. The park features an amphitheater that hosts concerts and cultural events, as well as an observatory, playground for children, and a cozy caf√©. Visitors can enjoy leisurely strolls amidst beautiful trees and colorful flowers while taking in the tranquil ambiance.

sources.snippet: La Constitucion Park is a bit hidden compared to La Represa or La Alameda Park, but it‚Äôs lovely and worth seeing. The green gardens with plants and flowers from different parts of the world, fountains and an amphitheatre make it so beautiful. One of the most photographed spots is the astronomy museum and observatory, which is in the shape of a dome.
sources.shortName: 15 Stunning Marbella Instagram Spots (Map Included!)

sources.snippet: Plaza de los Naranjos is my favorite place in Marbella Old Town. It is the main square and the historic city center of Marbella that is now filled with restaurants, shops, a fountain, orange trees, flowers, and countless picture-perfect Instagram photo spots!
sources.shortName: 17 best Instagram photo spots in Marbella Old Town, Spain

places.name: Parque de la Constituci√≥n

reviews.text: Great Park with great playground.  Our 4 and 2 year old sons really enjoyed playing and safe in shade. Toilets right by playground.  Walk then around park to see fountains and enjoy the greenery
We took a short cut through here for the obvious cool shade the trees provided and worth it. Park benches to take a break. Discovered lots of wild living green parrots next to a fountain.

Beautiful nature in the middle of the city, 2 min walking from the beach and the lighthouse.
The nature is simply amazing, several rare trees can be admired and also birds and cats.
A good place to rest and meditate.

places.address: Av. Arias Maldonado, 14, 29602 Marbella, M√°laga, Spain
